text: Approval for a name change from SAFHS 2000(R) to Exogen 2000(R).  The device is indicated for the acceleration of the time to a healed fracture for fresh*, closed, posteriorly displaced distal radius (Colles') fractures, and fresh*, closed or Grade I open tibial diaphysis fractures in skeletally mature individuals when these fractures are orthopedically managed by closed reduction and cast immobilization.  *All fractures in both clinical studies were treated with SAFHS(R) therapy within seven days for fracture.
